Question
========

One tests H~1~: p = 0.6 against H~2~: p = 0.9 in a random sample of n = 10 observations. Testing quantity is the binomially distributed stochast B, the number of successes in the sample. As the right critical limit, the value 9 is used. The discernment power 1 - Î² is then equal to

Answerlist
----------

* 0.9
* 0.95
* 0.99

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.9: Incorrect
* 0.95: Correct
* 0.99: Incorrect
